title: Potato Dauphinoise & Greens
description: Creamy, thinly sliced potato dauphinoise baked with garlic, cream, and nutmeg until golden and tender, served with a tangy sautéed greens side. Rich, comforting flavors balanced by brisk lemon and vinegar brightening the leafy greens.

ingredients.display_name: russet or Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and very thinly sliced (about 2 mm)
ingredients.notes: use a mandoline or sharp knife for uniform slices
can substitute part whole milk for lighter result but increases bake time
helps loosen cream and lighten texture
use for greasing dish and dotting top
can use 1 tsp dried thyme if unavailable

ingredients.display_name: freshly grated Gruyère or Swiss cheese
ingredients.notes: reserve a small handful for topping

ingredients.display_name: mixed greens (spinach and kale), stems removed and chopped

ingredients.notes: can use sherry or apple cider vinegar

ingredients.display_name: freshly ground black pepper for greens

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Generously butter a 22x30 cm (9x12 in) baking dish and rub one minced garlic clove over the base and sides for flavor.

Peel and very thinly slice the potatoes (about 1.5–2 mm thick) using a mandoline or sharp knife; keep slices uniform so they cook evenly. Pat slices dry with a clean towel or paper towel to remove excess surface moisture.

In a medium saucepan, combine heavy cream, whole milk, the remaining minced garlic, thyme, nutmeg, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper. Warm over medium heat until just below simmering (do not boil) and remove from heat.

Layer potatoes in the prepared dish in overlapping rows or concentric circles, seasoning each layer lightly with a pinch of salt and pepper. Continue until all potato slices are used, leaving a small mound in the center as they will settle during baking.
Pour the warm cream mixture evenly over the layered potatoes so it just comes up to the top of the potatoes. Scatter most of the grated Gruyère over the surface and dot with small pieces of butter.
Cover the dish tightly with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes to gently cook the potatoes through.

Remove the foil, sprinkle the remaining cheese evenly, and return to the oven uncovered for 10–15 minutes until the top is golden brown and bubbling and a knife slides easily into the center to indicate the potatoes are tender.
While the dauphinoise finishes, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add sliced shallot and sauté until translucent, about 2–3 minutes.

Add chopped kale first if using (it needs a couple minutes longer), sauté 2–3 minutes until it begins to soften, then add spinach and continue to cook, tossing until all greens are wilted and bright green, about 3–4 minutes more.
Remove greens from heat and finish with lemon juice, red wine vinegar, salt, pepper, and optional butter; toss to combine and adjust seasoning to taste.
Let the dauphinoise rest 5 minutes after removing from the oven to set slightly, then serve slices alongside the dressed greens.
